thread.section_title: Palm Beach County High School Sports - Sun Sentinel
thread.title: Atlantic rolls in win over Spanish River
thread.title_full: Atlantic rolls in win over Spanish River - Sun Sentinel

author: Steve Dorsey
title: Atlantic rolls in win over Spanish River
text:
Atlantic remained undefeated with a resounding 46-7 win Thursday night against visiting district rival Spanish River.
The victory improves the Eagles (5-0) to 2-0 in District 10-8A play, while Spanish River (4-2) drops to 1-2 in the district.
Atlantic is averaging 40.4 points a game and the Eagles wasted no time cranking up their high-powered offense, jump-starting the rout with a 21-yard touchdown run by Don'Dre Swint on the second play of the game. The score was set up by a 49-yard pass from Shawndarrius Phillips to Corey Gammage on the first play from scrimmage.
Atlantic scored on each of its next three possessions. Dontavius Monroe made it 14-0 with a 3-yard touchdown run and Phillips gave the Eagles a 20-0 lead on a 34-yard run.
Jerrod Ferguson's 8-yard touchdown run stretched Atlantic's lead to 26-0 four minutes into the second quarter. George Hunter intercepted a Owen Levine pass on the final play of the first half and returned it 75 yards for a touchdown to give Atlantic a 33-0 lead at halftime.
Spanish River scored its only touchdown on the fourth play of the second half when Levine connected with Dimitrius Hirsch on a 58-yard scoring pass, but Atlantic answered with a 74-yard touchdown run by Jerrod Ferguson and a 36-yard scoring run by Monroe to give the Eagles a 46-7 lead midway through the third quarter and ititiate a running clock for the remainder of the game.
Atlantic had 380 yards total offense, 238 yards coming on the ground. The Eagles' defense limited Spanish River only 32 yards rushing and 110 yards passing.
Despite the lopsided score, Atlantic coach T. J. Jackson said his team has plenty of room for improvement heading into the second half of the season, particularly with penalties. The Eagles were flagged for 115 yards in penalties.
"We've got to get rid of the flags. Way too many penalties," Jackson said. "We've still got to work on getting the right personnel on the field in certain situations and definitely work on our passing game."
